comments.body:
Is it okay that this will have some (very unlikely) collisions? The function just does this ```strconv.Itoa(r.Int() % 10000)```
I'm guessing yes, because it is still definitely an improvement to the flake rate. I guess I'm just wondering why framework doesn't have a way to generate suffixes that won't ever collide.

Actually I am not sure it's okay to have very unlikely collisions here. However I would argue that it is the right thing to use randomSuffix() is a utility from the framework meant to solve this problem. The correct thing to do is to use it and we should probably file a bug to fix this. I do not believe this PR is the right place to fix that bug.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +44,48 @@// CreateTestCRD creates a new CRD specifically for the calling test.
func CreateTestCRD(f *Framework) (*TestCrd, error) {
	suffix := randomSuffix()
	name := fmt.Sprintf("e2e-test-%s-%s-crd", f.BaseName, suffix)
	kind := fmt.Sprintf("E2e-test-%s-%s-crd", f.BaseName, suffix)
